title: Justin Bieber says ‘make an offer’ on his $12.6m mansion in Beverly Hills, California
text:
Justin Bieber has put the epic Californian mansion he shares with wife Hailey Baldwin up for sale, tempting fans to ‘make an offer’.

But the pop superstar decided not to go down the usual route of getting a real estate agent to sell his home.

RELATED: Where the world’s biggest celebrities stay when they’re in Australia

First glimpse inside Chris Hemsworth’s Byron Bay mega-mansion

The 25-year-old Canadian advertised the stunning US$8.5m (A$12.6m) home he owns in the elite Los Angeles neighbourhood of Beverly Hills for sale on Instagram. He tempted his 120 million followers on the social media platform saying: “I wanna sell”.

The newly married pop star shared no fewer than 12 photos of his Beverly Hills, California, mansion — nicknamed the Tropics — in a stream of uploads on his Instagram feed., reports the New York Post.

“I think I wanna sell my home in Beverly Hills who wants it,” Bieber wrote with a photo showing a den and part of a kitchen.

Another post, which shows Bieber’s shorts-clad legs as the camera points down a staircase lined with banana-leaf-print wallpaper toward a wine cellar, is captioned: “Home vibes, but I wanna sell it I think anyone interested?”

Certain comments from users, as are likely usual, beg Bieber to follow them back or like their posts, but others asked for a tour.

Not everyone took him seriously.

“Dude are you bored,” commented one user.

Other shots, captioned “Home vibes,” show images of his Super Shot arcade basketball game and an open kitchen and living area with beamed ceilings and hardwood floors.

A separate photo shows another staircase lined with apparently original works by the artist Kaws (with that post eliciting a reply from wife Hailey: “This is sick.”)

In his second-to-last upload, Bieber also makes an offer that certain deep-pocketed fans may not be able to refuse.

“I’ll sell it with all the furniture,” Bieber wrote under the image, which captures him lying on a couch and petting his $35,000 pair of part-exotic kittens. “MAKE AN OFFER.”

The uploads give a peek inside the home the lovebirds share.

The Biebers bought the spread for US$8.5 million earlier this year. It was listed for US$8.99 million, with the property description detailing its 1932 construction date and “Old Hollywood glamour mixed with casual California living,” per the old Realtor.com listing.

The 6,100-square-foot home has five bedrooms, seven bathrooms, a library and a home theatre. Then-sales brokers Hilton & Hyland posted a gallery on Instagram with photos of the gorgeous spread.

Much to the dismay of Beliebers, the home is not publicly listed.

Parts of this article first appeared in the New York Post and are republished here with permission.
description: Pop superstar Justin Bieber has put the stunning Beverly Hills mansion he shares with wife Hailey Baldwin up for sale, tempting fans to ‘make an offer’.
